subject: EJB testing: ClassCastExceptions thrown by narrow() in ant
msgSnippet: I am getting ClassCastExceptions thrown by calling PortableRemoteObject.narrow() when running my tests as an ant task. I m using the text only test runner, not
messageBody:
I am getting ClassCastExceptions thrown by calling
PortableRemoteObject.narrow() when running my tests as an ant task.
I'm using the text only test runner, not the GUI one.

The test is for an EJB and so it's trying to get a home interface for
the EJB it tests. The problem only occurs when the test runs in ant,
not when I run the test on the command line like so:

java -
classpath .\build\classes;.\lib\junit.jar;D:\bea\wlserver\lib\weblogic
.jar;.\lib\log4j.jar; junit.textui.TestRunner
com.pics.nmc2.media.ObjectGroupTest

I have read a few postings on this list regarding class loader issues
that at first looked relevant, but in fact they are all specific to
the GUI test runner, or running outside of ant, or maybe both. I
should mention the EJB container is Weblogic 6.1 SP2. I've had test
cases running on Weblogic 6.x before, but not with ant.

My ant test task in build.xml looks like this:

<target name="test" depends="init" >
<junit printsummary="on">
<classpath>
<pathelement location="${properties_dir}"/>
<fileset dir="${weblogic_home}/lib">
<include name="weblogic.jar"/>
</fileset>
<pathelement location="${build_dir}/classes"/>
<fileset dir="lib">
<include name="**/*.jar"/>
</fileset>
<fileset dir="d:\bea\utils">
<include name="**/*.jar"/>
</fileset>
<fileset dir="${build_dir}">
<include name="NMC2WebApp.war"/>
</fileset>
</classpath>
<formatter type="plain" />
<batchtest todir="${testreports_dir}">
<fileset dir="${src_dir}">
<include name="**/*Test*.java" />
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>
</target>

Some explanation of classloader issues with respect to running Junit
within ant would be welcome, even if you don't know exactly what the
problem is. Does it matter that the stub is loaded by a different
classloader on the server than in the client?

I'm using Junit 3.7 and Ant 1.4.1.

Thanks in advance.

Eliot Stock
Premiere Retial Networks
San Francisco
